Class w3c.amaya.HTTPConnection 

java.lang.Object
   |
   +----w3c.amaya.HTTPConnection
public class HTTPConnection
extends Object
Front end to the Jigsaw implementation of Java 1.1 API for Network accesses. Each object of this class correspond to an actual HTTP connection.

CONN_CLOSED
CONN_CONNECTED
CONN_FINISHED
CONN_KILLED
CONN_NEGOCIATED
CONN_NONE
CONN_STARTED
CONN_STOPPED
in
out
req
state
url

HTTPConnection()
initialize the connection with a clean state.

Close()
DoTransfer(int)
Negociate()
start up the connection stuff for real, this imply sending the request, and negociating with the server.
StartRequest(HTTPRequest)
Create a new connection associated to a request, it can fail if the URL sting is invalid of if the local host cannot connect to the server.
Stop()

 public static final int CONN_STARTED

HTTPConnection 
 public HTTPConnection()
initialize the connection with a clean state.

StartRequest 
 public static HTTPConnection StartRequest(HTTPRequest request)
Create a new connection associated to a request, it can fail if the URL sting is invalid of if the local host cannot connect to the server.

Parameters:
request - an HTTP request
Returns:
an HTTPConnection or null if it failed.
Negociate 
 public void Negociate()
start up the connection stuff for real, this imply sending the request, and negociating with the server.

DoTransfer 
 public int DoTransfer(int length)
Stop 
 public void Stop()
Close 
 public int Close()
